easy.notes: Easy groups: 1) items that commonly come in pairs; 2) fruits that you peal; 3) furniture you sit on; 4) bright colors seen in nature. Near-miss temptation: 'bonnet' could be mistaken for 'hat' but not a pair item, so it’s not included.

groups.name: Words that share a common prefix
Things that light up at night

medium.notes: Medium groups: 1) prefix 're-' words that feel related; 2) things that glow at night; 3) common compound words formed by two smaller words; 4) small woodland animals. Near-miss temptation: 'sunflower' could fit both 'light up at night' and 'two-part compound' but it’s more of a plant; keep to defined items to avoid overlap.

groups.name: Abstract connections: things that travel in waves
Words that become new words with -er suffix
Objects used to measure or compare size

hard.notes: Hard groups: 1) abstract idea: travel in waves includes sound/light/signal; 2) words that become new nouns when adding -er; 3) basic geometric shapes with straight edges; 4) measuring tools. Near-miss temptation: 'gauge' could be a measuring tool but is not included to avoid overlap with 'scale' and 'meter' groups.
